TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
This is also the first time, in 4 years of playing KSP, that I've *ever* landed anything on the runway!

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BWuVsu4JUvI?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Congratulations to ...

[@Hydrothermalventclam](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167200-hydrothermalventclam/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with the OV-01 Kestrel.

... on completing the K-Prize challenge and earning a 1st class award for the precision double achievement of landing on <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway and docking in orbit.

[@Mjp1050](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/159323-mjp1050/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Moustache.

... on completing the K-Prize challenge with a distinctive trefoil design and landing safely on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway.

Thanks for your mission reports and welcome to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

[@AVeryNiceSpacePenguin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/190842-averynicespacepenguin/) since you asked, tbh I dont know if it counts because its not certain from the mission report whether the X-20 Dynasoar <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> made orbit, since none of the screenies show it did and the report did not explicitly say that it did. If it did make orbit (with PE > 70km) then all you have to do is state this fact somewhere in the mission report as text and it would qualify.

![:prograde:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/prograde3.png ":prograde:")Godspeed!

Well alright then ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") congratulations to ...

[@AVeryNiceSpacePenguin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/190842-averynicespacepenguin/)  Advanced Pilot Precision Award with X-20 Dynasoar <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO.</abbr>

... on completing the K-Prize mission successfully in a compact and effective craft. Thanks for your mission reports and welcome to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list.

I just tried to make a small & fast <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, I think I did a pretty good job. I didn't make a name for it originally so I'm just going to call it SpeedyBoi V1.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/b9Xag5IDfn8?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Condor Mark V  

143,000 kg wet mass (no payload)  

177,000 kg wet mass (34,000 kg payload)  

I am back, and it has been around 7 months since my first, and only submission to this thread. I have returned with my very first, and very questionably functional, Large Scale <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, capable of lifting 34-40 tonnes into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>: **The Condor Mark V**. I wasted a good amount of <abbr title="Delta-V">DV</abbr> by burning way higher than I should have, but I ended up with enough to de-orbit and "land" on the Island Runway after overshooting the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway.  

A few things to say about this, this was the first successful orbit, and payload delivery of this craft after 5 design changes. This craft is extremely unstable during descent and re-entry, having a tendency to flip backwards, and tumble. I have come to the conclusion that after depleting all liquid fuel, and delivering it's payload, it's <abbr title="Center of Mass">Center of Lift</abbr> is more forward than it's <abbr title="Center of Lift">Center of Mass</abbr>. I will do further re-entry testing, and see if this can be remedied by pumping leftover oxidizer into the forward tanks. I would have landed on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway if it weren't for the tumbling, and I would have had a better landing on the Island runway if it wasn't for it's poor gliding characteristics. Credit where credit is due, it did glide for about 5-10~ Km. I hit the very edge of the island runway pretty hard and lost some parts, but for the most part, the 10th flight of the Condor was a success. 

~~don't ask about the first 9 flights, this was a learning experience for me~~  
**Images follow**

Spoiler

Thanks for your mission report and welcome to the K-Prize roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list! [@Bitrefresh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/146227-bitrefresh/) Thanks for your mission report for the flight of The Condor Mark V. I am sorry to say the loss of parts you mentioned on landing so courageously and desperately at the island runway is an automatic disqualification for the K-Prize. Since you already completed the challenge successfully you have the choice to have your mission linked as a gatecrasher, though the default is for the gatecrasher to be deftly brushed under the carpet and left unlisted, so say if you want the gatecrasher listing. **Edited November 15, 2018 by boolybooly**

on Year 4, Day 35, Hour 4 the 14th Rh-308A-7 (Condor Mark VII) Condor took off from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway with a solar array for the new station and fuel depot placed into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>. At around 2 minutes into flight, the spacecraft reached Mach 1.7, and pulled into a 15 degree climb into orbit.

![M5SrGh0.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/M5SrGh0.jpg)![WvjAnQw.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/WvjAnQw.jpg)![nH8uE0L.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/nH8uE0L.jpg)

5 minutes into flight, and the craft reached the edges of Kerbin's atmosphere and shut down it's engines to cycle to exo-atmospheric mode. 

![Um4XM2R.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/Um4XM2R.jpg)![A3EXiBF.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/A3EXiBF.jpg) 

It was at this point, shortly after orbital insertion, ground control lost contact with the craft and began to panic. It was in a stable orbit, but the craft was completely unresponsive, and did not appear on orbital tracking screens. The craft ran out of electricity. The cause was attributed to ground control's failure to extend the solar panels after exiting the atmosphere, and ground controller Derdos Kerman was temporarily suspended. An emergency launch of a Merlin Mark VII <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> piloted by Jebediah Kerman was scheduled in 1 day, and was on the runway the next morning.![75xjbUp.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/75xjbUp.jpg)*Merlin Mark VII Short Range <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> seen on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> Runway before flight.*

The flight proceeded normally and Jebediah caught up and inserted into orbit at the target altitude of 82km. He rendezvoused with the craft several hours later, not even having completed 1 orbit.

![AdxI8FG.png](https://i.imgur.com/AdxI8FG.png)![qMS1Kuv.png](https://i.imgur.com/qMS1Kuv.png)

It took Jebediah 12 minutes of careful maneuvering to dock with the Condor, but the operation went off without a hitch, and the Condor "Rhea" had power restored once docked with Jebediah's outdated Merlin. Jebediah returned to Kerbin within 3 hours after undocking with the Condor, and landed safely at the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>.![xQhDjfQ.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/xQhDjfQ.jpg)![jXAqCxo.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/jXAqCxo.jpg)![LppwrBJ.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/LppwrBJ.jpg)

The Condor raised it's orbit in order to properly come within a range to rendezvous with the space station, and the mission proceeded normally from that point on. With power restored, and a more competent ground control team established at mission control, the Condor docked with the station, installed the solar array, and then returned to Kerbin safely. ***The following images were released 2 hours after mission completion.***

Congratulations to [@Bitrefresh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/146227-bitrefresh/) on completing the K-Prize mission snatching success from the jaws of doom with the following accomplishments (added beneath the first mission listing).

- Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with [Condor Mark VII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3488068).

- Advanced Pilot Precision Award with [Merlin Mark VII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3488068).

Thanks for your engaging mission report and welcome back to the roll of honour aka K-Prize party guest list.

btw I left the Merlin entry as a standard APPA as I was not sure where it landed and took the mission log at face value for <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> terrain. If it landed on the runway then its an APPA 1st class and this can be corrected in the listing.
Nah it was just <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> terrain..it landed a little short and kinda rolled up to the lip of the runway and stopped.

Ok here it is, my K prize entry with R8-ZR - Flies like a butterfly, stings like the sharp end of a serrated blade!. This was really fun to build and fly and had the added bonus of being the final step in full reusability out to Minmus. I should have got into space planes a loonnggg time ago! All done on PS4 so fully stock, no mods. Full report in spoiler s.

![TicbKBI.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/TicbKBI.jpg)

[https://imgur.com/a/3166Gaw](https://imgur.com/a/3166Gaw)

I wish I made a video, that landing was silky smooth ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Would I get anything for delivering 500 units of mono prop to the same station? I'm  running low up there anyway so I might work it into my next flight.

Congratulations to [@Aquaticfantastic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189287-aquaticfantastic/) on a successful K-Prize mission resulting in the award of the highly prestigious Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with the R8-ZR. Thankyou for your mission report and welcome to the K-Prize party guest list, aka the roll of honour.

Regarding the question of delivering monopropellant to a space station in orbit, I think that counts as a Utilitarian Commendation, because it is transporting mass into orbit just like the release of a small satellite. Interestingly though there is no precedent for that as noone has done it yet to the best of my knowledge and so it is not included in the rules, so I will amend the rules.

Yay my first badge ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D"). I did do the monoprop delivery last night but didn't take any screenshots as it would be pretty much the same as previous report, got a satellite to drop into polar orbit which should be doable with this though!.  Working on a bigger version for cargo now may enter that for something once I'm happy with it (doesn't reach orbit right now).

OK [@Aquaticfantastic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189287-aquaticfantastic/) if you want to include that delivery mission for listing and kudos a text report will do, just need to know the name of the ship and details like dock/transfer in orbit and landing location and that no parts were lost etc. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) It was the same craft (R8-ZR), 500 units of mono from the plane into the station mono tanks, landed back at runway with no parts lost. I'll get a screenie next time, turns out my Mun station is low too (haven't unlocked drill or <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">isru</abbr> yet). If you want to wait for a proper report I will be launching my polar relay soonish as I believe it will result in the same award? Will be interesting hitting the runway from polar orbit too! I know you work off the honour system but id be happier proving it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

In which case, congratulations once again [@Aquaticfantastic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189287-aquaticfantastic/) on completing another successful K-Prize mission ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") which has been listed beneath your previous with the following kudos...

- Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with the R8-ZR.

... for completing a K-Prize first and delivering fuel to an orbiting ship. Thankyou for your mission report and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

Merry Christmas to the intrepid crews of Kerbal Space Program, may the Christmas star guide you all to a safe touchdown!

best booly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I made this in an old save around ~1.0 It worked back then I then uploaded it later, I was able to land it. If you need proof I will go dig for some screenshots: [https://kerbalx.com/lapis_space_program/crew-transport-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr>](https://kerbalx.com/lapis_space_program/crew-transport-ssto)

I am trying to build a more practical <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> than a tour bus. This [HKA-6B](https://kerbalx.com/TheFlyingKerman/HKA-6B)is what I've got so far...

So I’d like to submit an entry. I built my <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Intrepid and flew her to Laythe and back with a fuel stop on the way. Even landed back at the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway. Had no idea there was a prize for doing that mission :p

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed2423966902" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/181568-first-successful-ssto-mission-to-laythe-and-back/&tab=comments&do=embed&comment=3526251&embedComment=3526251&embedDo=findComment#comment-3526251" style="height:351px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

Edit: I’d like to also state in my report as the original mission report wasn’t a k-prize entry that Intrepid did make orbit, she passed through 5 SOIs(Kerbin, Duna, Jool, Tylo for gravity assist, And Laythe). Miraculously lost 0 parts as the Duna landing was pretty rough(good thing for its low gravity). Happy flying!!
